notesStmt.note: The first poem on folios 45a-46a seems to be in a mixture of Hebrew and Judeo-Greek. There are three Yehi Ratson poems starting with יהי רצון מלפניך י' אלהינו ואלהי אבותינו (e.g. 49a: Davidson 738 מ). Folios 48a-b and 49b contain sayings of Rabbi Meir, Rava and Ben Ha Ha quoted from Berakhot 17a. Mishnah Avot 5.22-3 is quoted on folio 50a. Interlinear correction on 49b.
Israel Davidson, Thesaurus of mediaeval Hebrew poetry (New York, 1924-1933).

msContents.summary: Liturgical booklet for a hazzan (prayer leader) with prayer, liturgical poetry and other texts relating to Shavu'ot according to the rite of Corfu. Shabtai Solomon ?Beleli produced the copy consisting of two parts (possibly for himself) in 1829. The first part contains the prayers, liturgical poems and instructions in Hebrew relating to the Shabbat before or on Shavu'ot and to the second evening of the same festival. The second part contains more such texts. The liturgical poems on folios 39a-b and 45a-46a might be in Judeo-Greek (folio 39 only partially) or otherwise in Ladino. Moses Gaster thought the hymn on folio 39a to be in Hebrew and Greek and the one on folio 45a in Hebrew, Greek and Italian. The scribe spells his family name in three different ways: title page ביללי, folio 40a בלילי and folio 50a בילילי.

msItem.title: Liturgical booklet
msItem.author: Shabtai ben Solomon ?Beleli
msItem.colophon: Title page reading in Hebrew: "התקפ"ט ראש חדש ניסן / חזניה של שבועת / קורפו / שבתי ב׳ שלמה ביללי / בשנת". Folio 40a: "אכי''ר שבתי ב'' שלמה בלילי / יצ''ו". Folio 50a: note reading in Hebrew: "בילילי שבתי ב׳ שלמה".

msItem.title: Gaster Hebrew MS 1635/3. Seder Shabbat ha-gadol shel Shavu'ot (Prayer book for the Great Shabbat of Shavu'ot) [ff. 1a-44b]. Prayers, liturgical poems and other texts relating to the Shabbat before or on Shavu'ot and to the second evening of the same festival. With partial Tiberian vocalisation. Marginal notes and/or corrections on folios 8b and 15b in different hands.
Gaster Hebrew MS 1635/2. Piyyut le-Shavu'ot [Poetry for Shavu'ot] [ff. 45a-50a].

supportDesc.foliation: Folio 1A (title page) not foliated. Folio 1a-44b Hebrew foliation at the top outer corner of side a of each folio from 1 [א] to 44 [מד]. Folios 45a-50b modern Hebrew pencil foliation at the top outer corner of side a of each folio, from 45 [מה] to 50 [נ].

p.catchwords: Folios 1a-44b: Catchwords on bottom left corner of each page. One or two catchwords do not match up with the word on the next page.

layoutDesc.layout: Long line with between 11 and 13 written lines on folios 45a-50a. Lead pencil ruling. Long line with 16 written lines on folios 1a-44b. Lead pencil ruling with pricking on both margins.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: The rubrics are in semi-cursive script.

decoDesc.decoNote: Front and back paste-downs: Large printed flowers with leaves and stems in light and dark blue.

[Flyleaf 2a]The text is surrounded by a frame. The top and bottom of the frame consist of black and blank bands, the right and left side have a carteled line. The upper three words of the title pages are each encircled.
16aAn ink decorative band marking a passage of the text.
17aA wavy line at the bottom of the page.
17bThe Decalogue is written inside a gate shaped frame. The inside of the frame has a wavy line.
18aThe Decalogue is written inside a gate shaped frame. The inside of the frame has a wavy line.
23bThe margins have crude pencil doodles.
24aThe margins have crude pencil doodles.
40aIn the middle of the page a small triangle made of small ink wavy lines.
46aAn ink band with cartels and dots.
46bGate design border with carteled line and dots in the pillars, and leaf-shaped motifs in the portal.
47aGate design border with carteled line and dots in the pillars, and leaf-shaped motifs in the portal.
47bGate design border with leaf-shaped motifs in the pillars and a carteled line with dots in the portal.
48aGate design border with leaf-shaped motifs in the pillars and a carteled line with dots in the portal.
48bGate design border with wavy lines with small circles in the pillars and circles with dots in the portal.
49aGate design border with wavy lines with small circles in the pillars and circles with dots in the portal.
49bGate design border with lozenges and cartels with dots in the pillars and rectangles with dots in the portal.
50aGate design border with lozenges and cartels with dots in the pillars and rectangles with dots in the portal.
50bCrudely sketched motif drawings in pencil.
[Flyleaf 1a]Crudely sketched motif drawings in pencil.
[Flyleaf 1b]Handwritten note in Latin "[…] Osma, Raffael Raffael Osma".

binding.p: Brown leather binding with blind tooling decoration on the margins, sewn on three raised cords. Blue ink flower on front and back paste-downs.

history.provenance: Acquired by The John Rylands Library from the heirs of Moses Gaster in 1954. Front flyleaf 1a: number 1635 handwritten with blue crayon. Folio 1a: Handwritten note in ink reading "1635 M. Gaster". Folio 50a: Handwritten note in pencil reading "50 fols. MG". Back Flyleaf 1b: Handwritten note in Latin "[…] Osma, Raffael Raffael Osma".
